citations.narrative:
While in the animal room, the inspector witnessed two spiny mice roaming free under the shelves. These mice had
escaped from their enclosure, likely due to an incorrectly closed lid per the facility representative.
Enclosures that are not maintained appropriately or that are not suitable for the species can lead to escape. Housing
facilities must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. All housing
facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to
contain the animals. The escaped spiny mice must be caught and returned to their enclosure.
To be corrected by February 21, 2024.

There are numerous small, winged insects in the animal room, some of which are inside the enclosure for one short-tailed
opossum.
Insect pests can cause contamination and disease as well as discomfort to the animals. The facility must establish and
maintain a safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests.
To be corrected by February 23, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
While in the animal room, the inspector witnessed two spiny mice roaming free under the shelves. These mice had 
escaped from their enclosure, likely due to an incorrectly closed lid per the facility representative.   
Enclosures that are not maintained appropriately or that are not suitable for the species can lead to escape. Housing 
facilities must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved.  All housing 
facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to 
contain the animals. The escaped spiny mice must be caught and returned to their enclosure. 
To be corrected by February 21, 2024. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
There are numerous small, winged insects in the animal room, some of which are inside the enclosure for one short-tailed 
opossum.  
Insect pests can cause contamination and disease as well as discomfort to the animals. The facility must establish and 
maintain a safe and effective  program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests. 
To be corrected by February 23, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
